string.text: What do you want?
I need to see your leader, Lukash. I have extremely important information for him.
Is this where Lukash and Shinkar are staying? I'd like to speak with one of them. Your guys sent me here.
Just looking around...
And what's so important?
Can you be more specific?
A Duty squad is hanging around nearby; your patrol spotted them. They asked me to relay the details to the Freedom leader in person.
I'm looking for information about Strelok or someone from his group. Also, I wouldn't turn down some work if we can strike a deal.

Whoa... Go on in, but don't even think about causing trouble here: they'll carry you out feet first. You'll find Lukash on the second floor.\nAnd keep in mind, if you're spinning a yarn about Duty just to get inside, you'd better say so now and beat it. If you do, I'll pretend this conversation never happened.
Alright, go on in. Just don't think about causing trouble: they'll carry you out feet first.
Why would I bother with such nonsense? My words are easy to verify; just contact your patrols.

Uh... well, yeah, I made it up a bit. I don't have any particularly valuable information... actually, it's the opposite—I'm looking for info myself. I figured your leader would be the most knowledgeable person here. That's why I wanted to talk to him first. I can pay for information... or I could carry out an assignment for you.
Fine.
Fine, go. But know this: in 15 minutes, I'm checking in with Lukash over the radio. If it turns out you haven't shown up to report, you'll have only yourself to blame.

Look at you, singing a different tune... Alright, I'm feeling generous today. We've got a drinking session with some shashlik planned for tonight, and you can't go into that in a bad mood... Plus, you didn't try to keep dodging and weaving, so you can go in. They'll keep an eye on you inside, just in case...
Just let me pass already, will you?
Whatever you say. And... thanks.
Hello, stalker. I am Major Cherepanov of Duty; we are carrying out a mission in this territory. Would you like to join us?
They call me the Marked One. What exactly are you planning here?
I don't, but I'm actually here on business. Your boss asked me to give you some funny numbers.

Just over the hill is the main breeding ground for those Freedom scumbags, which my boys and I are about to stir up properly.\nThere is, however, a small problem. There is only one entrance to the base, and it's heavily guarded. We thought about blowing a hole in the fence, but their sniper on the tower is in our way. I don't want to send my men into the line of fire... But he'll let you get close; he definitely won't shoot right away. Take him out and we'll make it worth your while—plus, you can take whatever gear you want from the base if the job succeeds.
What boss? Voronin? I don't give a damn about him... In short—I don't care about his orders!
Uh... where does this confidence come from that he'll let me get close? You don't want to risk your own, but you don't mind sending me into the line of fire?
There isn't even a sniper on that tower; open your eyes...
Really? Indeed... well then, sorry for the trouble. I won't suggest you join us on the raid; you aren't trained in our tactics, you don't know the commands, and anyway—this isn't your war.
I didn't really want to anyway...
No, a different one. Name's Ivantsov.
Well... you're not one of us. That's why the Freedomer won't think twice. Anyway, I've already said it: all you need to do is pick off the sniper on the tower behind the fence.\nSo, how about it?
And what did he pass on? Don't drag it out... uh... what was your name, by the way?
No, I don't want to be a part of this. It smells like a suicide mission. And besides... wetwork isn't really my thing.
Hold on... I'm such a blockhead! I'm actually here on an assignment from your superior. He asked me to pass along some numbers.
The name's Marked One. I was told to relay this: twenty-nine. Something about the thirteenth and eighth having moved out. He didn't say where. And why "Svyat"?
Then don't get under our feet, Marked One. Be on your way...
What superior? Voronin? I don't give a damn about him... In short—I don't care about his orders!

Twenty-ni-i-ine. I see. And Svyat—it's short for Svyatoslav. That's his name. Listen up. If you see him, tell him: Skull understood everything. Tell him: seven, seventy-two. Got it? Then he'll spare some supplies for you. Well, and... thanks. We'll put our heads together and figure out our next move here.
With great pleasure.
No, a different one. Name's Ivantsov.
Oh! Kindergarten games again. Take care!
Svyat? And what did he pass on? Don't drag it out, it's very important.
I was told to relay: twenty-nine. Something about the thirteenth and eighth having moved out. He didn't say where. And why "Svyat"?
Why are you constantly hovering around? If you don't want to prove yourself in a real mission, then get lost and take a walk.
Anything else, Marked One?
Look, just move along... You see how many real men have laid down their lives here...
What is this place?

We call it the Barrier... and that's pretty much what it is, in principle. Consider it the last normal checkpoint before the center of the Zone. It's a buffer, you know, between humanity and the darkness of the Zone.
And what's further ahead?

Further ahead is only death... well, or service to "Monolith." "Our Monolith! In thy name!.." Pfft!.. \nIn short, no one should go there. That's why we stand here, making sure no filth floods the Zone... We also hold back the particularly stupid ones. At least, we try to make sure they don't poke their noses toward the center.
Why do you do this?

If not us, then who? "Duty"? They are experts at exterminating monsters and undesirable stalkers, but just try to make them do something actually useful! Do you see them here? No? Exactly my point. We, for example, don't set a goal to destroy every creature living here. A barrier, a proper Barrier—that will be enough. The main thing is that neither side crosses the line...
And what if someone does cross it?
Anything can happen. Anything. I don't want to talk about it...
Halt! Access to the arsenal is permitted only to members of Freedom.
Chill out, you poor soul...
And what brought you to this godforsaken place, stalker? Better beat it while you still can!
Just passing through... I'm looking for something and wanted to look around. What's so scary about this place?

Ah, look around... So it's your first time here. Well, that's different then... We're waiting for someone; a signal came from the village. But God only knows what's going on in that village! Vlad said he saw bloodsuckers here. Though, he might have been joking...
Bloodsuckers? Did you see them?

No. Vlad and Yuras headed towards the water tower... We're just sitting here for now, waiting. Go ahead and take a walk, don't be afraid, since you want to look around.\nEverything seems quiet, just those poltergeists floating about. And listen... if you find anything interesting, let us know later.
How kind of you... Alright, I'm going.
Is that you making all that noise? Scaring off the bloodsuckers?
Just passing through... Looking for something, wanted to check the area. Yeah, I saw the bloodsuckers, gave them a proper scare. What about it?

So you saw them? We're waiting for someone here; a signal came from the village. But God knows what's happening in that village! Vlad said he saw bloodsuckers here too... He and Yuras went to scout it out. You just keep going where you were going, look around. And listen... If you find anything interesting, let us know later.
Brave souls... Alright, I'm going.
Well? Any luck?
You guys are... "jokers." Nothing scary, my foot! I barely made it out alive! There are bloodsuckers all over the place.
Whoa! No kidding! Well, man, you owe us one for staying alive! By the way, did you find anything interesting there? Maybe... a curious corpse or something.
Joking again? Thanks... I didn't find anything.
Why are you wandering around here like a ghost?
Just looking around.
Oh! Hey, man! What are you scouting for? Looking for someone?
Just looking for something... Why?
Couldn't find a better spot? This might be the shittiest place in the Zone...
What's so bad about it?
You don't know? So it's your first time here... Hmm...
So, you don't actually know yourselves?

No. Vlad and Yuras headed towards the water tower... and we're just sitting here for now, waiting. Go ahead and take a walk, don't worry, since you want to look around...\nEverything seems quiet, just those poltergeists floating about...
Bloodsuckers, you say? Hmm...
Damn, you really brought the heat! You've got skills!
What are you talking about?
Well... we saw how you handled those bloodsuckers... Tough, very tough, I'll give you ?that. By any chance, did you see our guys there? Yuras and Vlad headed to the water tower this morning...
No, I didn't see them. I only saw some corpses.

Corpses, huh... Well, that's what we figured. Was there a metal briefcase by any chance? You never know... If you happen to come across it, stop by and see our man Shinkar; he was really torn up about the loss...
Shinkar? Who's that?
He's our trader, sits at the base counting his cash... buys artifacts from stalkers, peddles gear... in short, a businessman. You'll find out for yourself what a nice guy he is...
Whoa! Now that's what I'm talking about! You've got skills! The way you took those bastards down...
Are you joking?! I just got lucky; I barely made it out alive!
Oho, you really brought the heat! Listen... how are our guys? Did you see them?
Yeah, I saw them... or what was left of them...
I see... Was there a metal briefcase by any chance? Just in case... If you find it, head over to our Shinkar; he was incredibly upset about losing it...
Shinkar? Who's that?
To Shinkar? Yeah, sure thing...
He's our trader, sits at the base counting his cash... buys artifacts from stalkers, peddles gear... in short, a businessman. You'll find out for yourself what a nice guy he is...
Well? Finished looking around? You're a lucky one...
Yeah, I'm looking... You guys are real jokers.
Oh! Hey, man! What are you scouting for? Looking for someone?
Just looking for something... Why?
Couldn't find a better spot? This might be the shittiest place in the Zone...
What's so bad about it?

You don't know? So it's your first time here... Hmm... We're waiting for a guy here, our designated marksman. Íî God only knows what's going on in that village! Vlad said he saw bloodsuckers here... though, he might have been joking... There's nothing bad there, I was just kidding. And listen... if you find anything interesting, let us know later.
So you don't actually know yourselves?

No. Vlad and Yuras headed towards the water tower... and we're just sitting here for now, waiting. Go ahead and take a walk, don't worry, since you want to look around...\nEverything seems quiet, just those poltergeists floating about...
Bloodsuckers, you say? Hmm...
Well? Any luck? We saw you playing the hero out there...
Are you joking?! There are bloodsuckers there, I barely made it out alive!
No way! Well, my congratulations! The main thing is you stayed in one piece...
Joking again? Thanks...
Hey there, man! I'm Max. Haven't seen you around here before. You here on business, or just decided to take a breather?
The name's Marked One. Business, mostly. I'm looking for some information, and I wouldn't turn down some work either.

If it's business, check out that building over there first. You'll find our leader there—goes by the name Lukash. You can also have a chat with Shinkar. After that, swing back here; maybe we can figure out some job to do together.
Alright, I'll be back.
Hi, Marked One! Sorry, I'm waiting for someone right now. We'll chat later.
Whatever you say.
Have you ever dealt with psychos before? Because we've got one here. Think you can get him to talk? If everything goes well, I'll owe you a bottle.
In the Zone, every second person is a psycho. If not every single one. I can talk to him. What do you need to find out?

Here's the deal: there's a guy holed up in a shack on stilts in the swamp to the right of the road. My guys saw him rushing out of the Red Forest, headlong. He clearly saw something that made him lose his mind. He was mumbling about something... ghosts, some secrets, fragments. I tried to make sense of it, but...\nI have a feeling it's something important, smells like a serious haul, but I can't catch the drift. Try talking to him; if you find anything, you'll get a cut.
Oh! That weirdo! I've been bringing him food...
Hmm... thing is, he kicked the bucket... Yeah.
Right, our joker Cook says he's feeding a relative. Well, let him; he's still a human being after all.
Are you sure? What a stroke of bad luck. I guess we're back to square one. Shame. I think there was something interesting in his head. Oh well, this time the ball missed the goal...
So, how's it going? Everything good? Come on, take a seat, dry your socks, and wet your whistle. Make yourself at home. We're all friends here...
Greetings, wanderer. Well, did you visit the nutjob? What exactly did that psycho find out there?
Well, that nutjob of yours bit the dust, so...
I had a talk with that crazy guy...
Nah, haven't had the time yet. I'll get around to it sometime.
Well, did you make any sense of it? Or was it just the same old "I'm scared of ghosts, superior people," and so on?
Yeah, go ahead. Time's ticking; someone else might grab whatever he knew for themselves.
Well... how should I put it. Not much, really. Except, from what I gathered, he's not mumbling about ghosts, but about Ghost. Ever heard of a stalker with that handle?

Uh-huh. Yeah, I've heard of him. Seen him too. Shady guy. Always asking questions, always disappearing and appearing out of nowhere. Kind of like you. There was a rumor for a while that he and his buddy—Strelok—found a way to reach the very center, the Sarcophagus. But I have my doubts, honestly. What's he to you?

It seems he or Strelok could help me remember who I am. That psycho mentioned some kind of tool, said he found it in a red tank in the forest. I didn't quite get it, to be honest. Does that ring a bell?

In the forest? Well... there's only one forest nearby, the Limansk Reserve, stalkers call it the Red Forest. You probably know that. Maybe it's the Red Forest he meant, not a red tank? And if so, maybe he meant a tank *in* the Red Forest? I don't recall anything like that, though who knows—it's wild out there, maybe there are tanks standing around somewhere. Nah. I wouldn't poke my nose into that forest based on such a weak lead. To hell with that. As for the tools, I heard someone say some drunkard in Limansk was blabbering about them. He was talking nonsense... What do you think yourself?

I think a psycho is just a psycho, what can you expect. But if I get a chance, I'll check what kind of tank it is. Or ask around in Limansk if I head that way. Maybe things will clear up. Anyway, you owe me a bottle!
You bet! I'll even throw in some ammo. Never hurts to have extra, right?
Hey there, brother! How's life? Relax, have a drink. Or did you want something?
Dude, you're at the Freedom base! Relax, make yourself at home!
I'm not exactly tensing up.

Just stay within the bounds of decency, alright? If you start acting out, you've only yourself to blame. We had one guy here who didn't get it; he annoyed everyone so much we sent him for a stroll through a minefield in his birthday suit. Shinkar was swearing up a storm when that guy's arm landed on his head... You catch my drift?
I catch it, I catch it.
Good man! You're free to go.
Ah, fresh meat...
I don't follow.
What's there to follow? Think about it: times are lean lately...
What do you mean?
I mean exactly what I said! A hungry soldier is a bad soldier. And look how many of us there are here...
And?
Where are we supposed to get enough meat? Then you show up, just like you were ordered!
Uh...
Relax, man, I'm just joking. We don't see new faces often, so I decided to see what kind of character you are. Alright, move along, I'm supposed to be on patrol here...
Hey man, did something break on you?
Break?
So you're not here for me? Wow! I'm fed up already. As soon as something breaks, everyone runs here and starts whining.
And who are you?

I'm a mechanic. A handyman... Screw, that's what they call me. I repair all kinds of machinery and basically anything they bring in. Right now, I've decided to fix up these vehicles. To drive through the Zone with the breeze... Ah, a dream... Well, how should I address you?
I'm the Marked One.
What brings you our way? It's not often we see a new face around here. They don't just let anyone onto the territory, as I'm sure you already know.
I'm just looking around mostly. Also wanted to ask the local folk about a few things. Or maybe there's some work here for me.
Ah... then you'd better head straight to Lukash, he's the one in charge. You'll find him in the building next door.
Thanks. I'll be going then...
Wait, you wouldn't happen to have some vodka on you, would you? I'd give you, say, a couple of weapon repair kits in exchange. Interested?
I'm interested, but I don't have any with me.
I've got a bottle saved for a special occasion. Here, take it.
That's a shame. You should always have stuff like that with you. You never know. If you get some, stop by, don't be shy. We'll have a few drops to toast our acquaintance.
Well, thanks! Much appreciated. I'll knock it back in a bit. And this is for you, as promised.
No problem.
Thanks to you too. I'll be going...
Don't bother me, I'm thinking...
Did you actually bring some of the white stuff?
Nah, I just dropped in to say hello...
Too bad, we could've sat down and knocked back a couple of glasses...
Well, hello there, stalker. Wanted something? What's your name, by the way?
Hello. I'm the Marked One. Just checking things out. Are you trading?
Hmm, I've got a little bit of everything. I keep our folks supplied with all sorts of necessities. Not for your pretty eyes, of course.
Do you accept rubles? The ones from the PDA?

Can't do without 'em, so yes. Sidorovich hasn't let me down yet, he's keeping his word. So, I'll sell you some small odds and ends for those thin-air coupons. But if you need something more serious, get your artifacts ready.
I see. Same as everywhere else.
And what interesting things have you brought me?
Ah, it's you. What do we desire?
Nothing, just looking around. Actually, I'm looking for a man—Ghost. Haven't heard of him?
Hmm... how could I not have heard... By the way, do you know where Bloodsucker Village is?
Well... sort of. I'm not a frequent guest here; I might get turned around.

That's good... I mean... well, that's not what I'm talking about... An unpleasant situation has developed... Ghost needs help urgently. His signal was coming from the village, but I've got no one to send to help a good man; I might as well call Duty at this rate.
Get to the point.
A couple of guys went into the village, and the other three are just sitting on the outskirts. If you help them, I'll make it worth your while. Are you in?
Not this time.
Look, it's like this... Ghost might die. We have to bail the guy out.
I'm in.
Good. Make it quick.
Can I get some gear from you?
For the right price, you can get anything.
You were pulling my leg, friend. There's no Ghost out there, just bloodsuckers. Thank God I managed to deal with them.

Whoa, take it easy, stalker! Quick to jump the gun, aren't you... \nI never said anything to you about Ghost... you must have misheard. I said Prosaic, that's who I meant. Looks like he's the one who met his end there. Anyway, here's something for your heroics.
Well, how did it go?
You were feeding me a line, friend. There's no Ghost there, just bloodsuckers. Thank God I killed the beasts.
Was it tough?
It was alright, manageable.

Curious, isn't it... all sorts of nastiness crawling out of the center of the Zone. Where does it even come from? \nAnd I didn't tell you about Ghost... you misheard me. I was talking about Prosaic, that's who I meant. Seems he's the one who bit the dust. Here, take this for your heroics.
I even sent some guys to help you out!
I've changed my mind, I don't want to take the risk.
Suit yourself. Just don't expect anything from me then.
Whatever, life is worth more than a reward.
Don't get worked up! I'll give it a shot after all.
Hold your horses. I need to get prepared!
Prepare all you want, just don't take too long.
So, what's the status on those bloodsuckers? Time is wasting... This is bad.
Don't panic, it'll be done.
Forget those bloodsuckers! My life is worth more...
It'll be done, sure... You'll be done like a dinner. I thought you were a man of your word, but you're just... all talk.
Looking out for number one, are we? Well... maybe you're right, maybe you're right.
Word around here is you wiped out the bloodsuckers in the village. True or not?
I handled it...
Hmm... Was it a struggle?
Manageable. Did you have a personal interest there?
Well... Yes, I did. I think the matter will be settled now. Oh! Well, for your heroics, take this...
Hmm... Not exactly a fortune.
You said it yourself, it wasn't that difficult.
Well, hello, Marked One. What did you bring? Or are you in need of something else?
Who's in charge of supplies around here, and where can I find them?
What the hell do you need him for?
Just looking to stock up on some food.

Cook is responsible for the grub; he's usually in the canteen. It's that long building, right after the bridge. You'll see it immediately. But you're better off going to Shinkar anyway, because Cook is likely wasted again: just sits there, mumbling something incoherent under his breath...
Mumbling?
What did you expect? A drunk is a drunk. If he didn't know how to cook, we would've sent him packing long ago.
Understood. Thanks.
Don't mention it.
Who runs things around here?
Why do you want to know?
I'm looking for some information. I have the means to pay, don't worry. Or I could handle an assignment, if we can strike a deal.
I have important information to report from your patrols.
Lukash is our commander. Head straight into the main building. You'll find Shinkar there too; he's more on the trade side, but he knows a lot of people... and a lot of things.
Thanks.
